definitions.definition: An act or instance of bursting.
definitions.example: The bursts of the bombs could be heard miles away.

definitions.definition: A sudden, often intense, expression, manifestation or display.
A series of shots fired from an automatic firearm.

definitions.example: I blew the balloon up too much, and it burst.

definitions.definition: To cause to break from internal pressure.
definitions.example: I burst the balloon when I blew it up too much.

definitions.definition: To cause to break by any means.
To separate (printer paper) at perforation lines.
definitions.example: I printed the report on form-feed paper, then burst the sheets.

definitions.definition: To enter or exit hurriedly and unexpectedly.
To erupt; to change state suddenly as if bursting.
definitions.example: The flowers burst into bloom on the first day of spring.

definitions.definition: To produce as an effect of bursting.
definitions.example: to burst a hole through the wall

definitions.definition: To interrupt suddenly in a violent or explosive manner; to shatter.
